metadata.titleEn: Data set of bird distribution along altitudinal gradient in Motuo and Chayu, southeastern Tibet (2019-2020)
metadata.description: In order to reveal the spatial pattern of bird diversity distribution and explore the construction mechanism of Himalayan bird community. In 2020, a total of 775 bird survey sites will be collected in Chayu and Motuo counties of Nyingchi Prefecture, Tibet Autonomous Region. This data set contains a sample information table, which contains 4029 bird observation data. Each information includes species name, Latin name, sampling place, survey time, investigator, altitude, habitat type, distance from the midpoint and other basic information, which is stored in Excel. The corresponding photos and videos were collected into the data set of the animal special topic "the second Qinghai Tibet scientific research plateau animal diversity protection and sustainable use (2019qzk0501) photo and video (2020)".
metadata.instructions:
"File name: the text information is stored in Excel format, and the file name is" data set of birds distribution along altitude gradient in Motuo and Chayu of Southeast Tibet (2019-2020) - sample information table. XLX ".
Data reading method: the information of the data set can be read by Office Excel, and the main content includes Chinese name, Latin name, sampling place, survey time, investigator, altitude, habitat type, distance from the midpoint and other basic information of bird species, as well as corresponding habitat photos. "

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of data collection techniques used to study bird diversity across altitudinal gradients in the Himalayan region?
Example.Answer: An example of data collection techniques used to study bird diversity across altitudinal gradients in the Himalayan region involves collecting bird survey data from 775 sample points in the Linzhi area of Tibet's Chayu and Motuo counties. The collected data includes 4029 bird observation records, detailing species name, Latin name, sampling location, survey time, surveyor, altitude, habitat type, and distance to the midpoint. This information is stored in an Excel spreadsheet.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the essential features of data collection techniques for studying bird diversity along altitude gradients in Himalayan regions?
Feature Specification.Answer: species name, Latin name, sampling location, survey time, surveyor details, altitude, habitat type, distance from the midpoint

Quantification.Question: How many bird observation data entries are included in a dataset focused on the altitudinal gradient distribution of birds in the Tibetan region from 2019 to 2020?

Definition.Question: What is the meaning of 'bird observation data' in the context of biodiversity studies across altitudinal gradients?
Definition.Answer: Bird observation data refer to the collected information on bird species, including species name, Latin name, sampling location, survey time, surveyor, altitude, habitat type, and distance from the central point, as part of efforts to reveal spatial patterns of bird diversity and explore the mechanisms of Himalayan bird community construction.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contributed to the selection of sample sites for bird diversity surveys along altitudinal gradients in the Himalayas?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The selection of sample sites for bird diversity surveys was influenced by the need to reveal spatial patterns of bird diversity and explore the community assembly mechanisms of Himalayan birds. In 2020, data collection focused on the Linzhi area in Tibet Autonomous Region, specifically in Chayu County and Motuo County, with 775 bird survey sample points collected.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of collecting bird distribution data along an altitudinal gradient in the Himalayas?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective is to reveal the spatial patterns of bird diversity distribution and to explore the mechanisms of community construction of Himalayan birds.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the procedural steps involved in collecting bird distribution data along an elevation gradient in a mountainous region?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection involved gathering information from 775 survey sample points in the regions of Motuo and Chayu in the Linzhi area of Tibet. The process included recording 4029 bird observations, each detailing species name, Latin name, sampling location, survey time, surveyor, altitude, habitat type, and distance to midpoint. The data was stored in an Excel spreadsheet, and corresponding photos and videos were compiled in a related dataset focused on biodiversity protection and sustainable use.

Enablement.Question: What data collection techniques enable the comprehensive documentation of bird species distribution along elevation gradients in Himalayan regions?
Enablement.Answer: The data collection methods involve gathering information from 775 bird survey sampling points in the Himalayan regions of Tibet, specifically in the Nyingchi area, including Zayü and Motuo counties. The comprehensive documentation includes collecting 4029 bird observation data entries with details such as species name, Latin name, sampling location, survey date, surveyor, elevation, habitat type, and distance to midpoint, all stored in an Excel format.
